title: Mudeford Walks

images.title: Mudeford Spit Jetty by Mike Smith, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Mudeford Spit Jetty. The ferry to Mudeford Quay docks here at the jetty which protrudes from the spit into the deeper channel in Christchurch Harbour.

images.title: ITookSomePhotos, CC BY-SA 4.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/4.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Mudeford Spit, Dorset, England

images.title: Jim Champion / More beach huts on Mudeford Spit
images.caption: More beach huts on Mudeford Spit. Looking along the 'backs' of some beach huts that look out across Christchurch Bay towards the Isle of Wight (to the right). Note the panels of solar cells mounted on the south-facing roof slopes. The yellow diamond sign warns of a submerged telephone cable.

images.title: Ferry leaving Mudeford Quay by Paul Buckingham, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Ferry leaving Mudeford Quay

images.title: Hengistbury Head: the Ironstone Quarry by Jonathan Hutchins, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Hengistbury Head, the Ironstone Quarry

images.title: Jim Champion / View from the triangulation pillar, Hengistbury Head
images.caption: View from the triangulation pillar, Hengistbury Head. On the left in the foreground is an 'orientation plinth', beyond that on the right the old Coastguard lookout and mast. In the far distance is the western tip of the Isle of Wight, including the Needles rocks and lighthouse.

description: This walk in Dorset explores the area around Mudeford quay and green before catching the ferry over the water to Mudeford Spit. Here you can enjoy a walk along the beach and the dunes where you will pass the attractive little beach huts. The walk then climbs to the viewpoint on Hengistbury Head where you can enjoy some splendid views over Mudeford to the Isle of Wight. You can start the walk from the good sized car parking area at Mudeford Quay and enjoy a walk around the little park and picnic area with fine views over Christchurch Harbour . There's a nice cafe here for refreshments as well. To continue your walking in the area head east from the car park to visit Highcliffe Castle where there's some fine architecture and pretty gardens to explore.
